clinical_study.official_title: Phase I/II Clinical Trial of Haematopoietic Stem Cell Gene Therapy for the Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase I/II study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of Hematopoietic Stem Cell genetherapy for the Wiskott-Aldrich Syndrome.

detailed_description.textblock: This clinical trial is an ex vivo gene therapy trial. The investigational product corresponds to autologous CD34+ cells transduced with a lentiviral vector harboring the human WASP gene.

primary_outcome.description: Improvement in eczema status as compared with the baseline status at study entry on clinical evaluation

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in the frequency and severity of infection episodes
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in the frequency and severity of infection episodes as compared with the baseline status and the patient's historical data collected over the 2 years prior to study entry

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in the frequency and severity of bruising and bleeding episodes
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in the frequency and severity of bruising and bleeding episodes as compared with the baseline status and the patient's historical data collected over the 2 years prior to study entry

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in the frequency and severity of autoimmune disorders
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in the frequency and severity of autoimmune disorders as compared with the baseline status at study entry

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in the number of disease related days of hospitalization
primary_outcome.description: Reduction in the number of disease related days of hospitalization as compared with the patient's historical data collected over the 2 years prior to study entry

secondary_outcome.measure: Occurrence and type of adverse events
secondary_outcome.description: Occurrence and type of adverse events reported during the course of the study
Assessment of weight, vital signs, ECG and laboratory exams during the course of the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of lentivirus gene transfer into Hematopoietic Stem Cells
secondary_outcome.description: Detection of replication competent lentivirus (RCL) and lentivirus integration sites analysis
Improvement of microthrombocytopenia as compared with the baseline evaluation at study entry

secondary_outcome.measure: Decrease in the number and volume of platelets transfusions
secondary_outcome.description: Decrease in the number and volume of platelets transfusions as compared with patient's historical data collected over the 2 years prior to study entry

secondary_outcome.measure: Evidence of sustained engraftment of WASP-expressing transduced cells
secondary_outcome.description: Quantification of vector copy numbers and detection of vector-derived WASP expression

secondary_outcome.measure: Reconstitution of humoral and cell mediated immunity
secondary_outcome.description: Reconstitution of humoral and cell mediated immunity as compared with the baseline evaluation at study entry

intervention.intervention_name: Autologous CD34 positive cells transduced with a lentiviral vector containing human WAS gene
intervention.description: transplantation of patient's autologous CD34+ cells transduced with lentiviral vector containing human WAS gene

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- males of all ages
- severe WAS (clinical score 3-5) or absence of WAS protein in peripheral blood mononuclear cells determined by Western blotting and flow cytometry
- molecular confirmation by WAS gene DNA sequencing
- lack of HLA-genotypically identical bone marrow after 3 month search
- lack of a 10/10 or 9/10 antigen HLA-matched unrelated donor after 3 month search
- lack of a HLA-matched cord blood after 3 month search
- parental, guardian, patient signed informed consent/assent
- willing to return for follow-up
- only for patients who have received previous allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplant:
- failed allogenic hematopoietic stem cell transplant
- contraindication to repeat transplantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- patient with HLA-genotypically identical bone marrow
- patient with 10/10 or 9/10 antigen HLA-matched unrelated donor or with HLA-matched cord blood
- contraindication to leukapheresis
- contraindication to bone marrow harvest
- contraindication to administration of conditioning medication
- HIV positive patient
